intro: Raveniopsis microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved raveniopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for cultivation in warm climates. Due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms, it is occasionally grown as a decorative plant in botanical gardens and private collections.
